skill.name: slack-gif-creator
skill.description: Knowledge and utilities for creating animated GIFs optimized for Slack. Provides constraints, validation tools, and animation concepts. Use when users request animated GIFs for Slack like "make me a GIF of X doing Y for Slack."
skill.summary: Knowledge and utilities for creating animated GIFs optimized for Slack. Provides constraints, valida...

security_audit.summary: Official Anthropic skill with a minimal audit. No security issues found in the local image processing utilities and validators.

content.value_statement: You need GIFs that fit Slack size and motion limits. This skill builds frames, optimizes colors, and validates output for Slack.
actual_capabilities: Assemble frames into GIFs with size and fps control.
Resize frames to Slack emoji dimensions when requested.
Quantize colors using a global palette for smaller files.
Remove near duplicate frames to reduce file size.
Validate GIF dimensions, size, and frame count for Slack.
Provide easing based interpolation values for smooth motion.
limitations: Does not upload GIFs to Slack or manage Slack APIs.
Requires local image files and Python libraries listed in requirements.
Does not provide prebuilt art assets or emoji fonts.
Validation reports size but does not enforce Slack file size limits.

use_cases.title: Polished emoji animation
use_cases.description: Create a short 128x128 emoji GIF with smooth easing and optimized colors.

use_cases.title: Programmatic GIF build
use_cases.description: Generate frames with PIL, assemble a GIF, and validate dimensions for Slack.

use_cases.title: Quick reaction GIF
use_cases.description: Turn a simple concept into a small, looped reaction GIF for Slack.

prompt_templates.title: Simple emoji GIF
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a 128x128 Slack emoji GIF of a pulsing heart. Use 12 frames, 10 fps, and optimize for emoji size.

prompt_templates.title: Gradient star bounce
prompt_templates.scenario: You want a small animated icon
prompt_templates.prompt: Build a 128x128 GIF with a bouncing star on a gradient background. Use easing for bounce and limit colors to 48.

prompt_templates.title: Message GIF
prompt_templates.scenario: You need a larger message GIF
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a 480x480 message GIF of a rotating coin. Use 20 frames, 15 fps, and validate Slack dimensions.

prompt_templates.title: Advanced optimization
prompt_templates.scenario: You need a very small file
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a 128x128 GIF with 10 frames. Deduplicate frames, use global palette with 32 colors, and report final size.

output_examples.input: Make a 128x128 emoji GIF of a bouncing ball, 12 frames at 10 fps, optimized for Slack.
output: Created 12 frames at 10 fps for a 1.2 second loop
Resized frames to 128x128 and reduced colors to 48
Saved GIF and reported size, dimensions, and frame count

best_practices: Use 128x128 for emoji GIFs and keep duration under three seconds.
Reduce colors and remove duplicate frames to shrink file size.
Run validation after saving to confirm Slack ready dimensions.
anti_patterns: Request Slack uploads or API integration.
Assume prebuilt graphics or emoji fonts exist.
Use large dimensions with high fps and many colors.

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes. It provides Python utilities and guidance that work with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code.

faq.question: What are the size and frame limits?
faq.answer: It supports Slack friendly dimensions and reports file size. You control fps, colors, and frame count.

faq.question: Can it integrate with Slack to upload GIFs?
faq.answer: No. It only creates and validates GIF files on disk.

faq.question: How is my data handled?
faq.answer: The skill works locally with your files and does not transmit data.

faq.question: What should I do if validation fails?
faq.answer: Resize to 128x128 for emoji or adjust aspect ratio and rerun validation.

faq.question: How does it compare to generic GIF tools?
faq.answer: It focuses on Slack constraints, optimization, and easing utilities for programmable GIF creation.
